perturbation.original_text: "Business Day" means any day except a Saturday, Sunday, or a Federal Reserve Bank holiday. A Business Day shall open at 8:00a.m. and close at 5:00p.m. Houston, Texas, time.
perturbation.changed_text: "Business Day" means any day the parties agree to conduct business. A Business Day shall have no fixed hours of operation.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition aligns with standard legal and business practices. The modified definition introduces ambiguity by making the definition of a "business day" dependent on the parties' agreement, which can be changed arbitrarily. This contradicts the legal certainty required for contractual obligations and timelines and conflicts with the common understanding of what constitutes a business day, potentially invalidating time-sensitive clauses within the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Creates ambiguity and uncertainty in interpreting the contract's timelines and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: "Inventory Market Value" shall mean the then current market value of Inventory as determined by Bunker One on a mark-to-market basis in a commercially reasonable manner.
perturbation.changed_text: "Inventory Market Value" shall mean the value of Inventory as determined solely by Bunker One, using any method they deem appropriate.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies "a commercially reasonable manner" for determining market value, implying an objective standard. The modification removes this safeguard and allows Bunker One to arbitrarily determine the value, potentially to the detriment of Vertex. This creates a conflict of interest and contradicts principles of fair dealing and good faith often implied in commercial contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: 13.1. This Agreement shall be governed, interpreted and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Alabama, without giving effect to its conflict of laws provisions. Any dispute arising out of or in connection with this JSMA, including without limitation any question regarding its existence, validity or termination, that is not resolved in accordance with the provisions set forth below in Section 13.3, shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the United States District Court for the Southern District of Alabama in the City of Mobile, unless that court does not have subject-matter jurisdiction or declines jurisdiction, in which case any such dispute shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the State Court for the State of Alabama, City of Mobile, as described in the following paragraphs.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.1. This Agreement shall be governed, interpreted, and construed according to principles of fairness as decided by the presiding arbitrator, ignoring the laws of any specific jurisdiction. Any dispute shall be submitted to binding interpretive dance, judged by three randomly selected toddlers.
perturbation.explanation: This change replaces a standard choice of law and forum selection clause with a nonsensical and legally invalid dispute resolution mechanism. It explicitly rejects the application of any state's laws and replaces it with undefined 'principles of fairness.' The reference to 'interpretive dance' and 'randomly selected toddlers' renders the dispute resolution process completely unenforceable and contradicts fundamental principles of contract law and the legal system.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic Contract Law - Enforceability of contracts requires a clear and understandable dispute resolution process.
